FAQ.question: What is an FMB Sketch (Non-Agriculture)?
FAQ.answer: An FMB (Field Measurement Book) Sketch is an official land map that shows the exact boundaries, measurements, and layout details of non-agricultural properties such as residential plots, commercial sites, and converted lands.

FAQ.question: Why is the FMB Sketch important?
FAQ.answer: It is required for property verification, boundary confirmation, layout approvals, construction planning, fencing, and resolving boundary-related disputes.

FAQ.question: What details are needed to obtain the FMB Sketch?
FAQ.answer: You need the district, taluk, village/ward, survey number or plot number, sub-division number (if any), and owner/property details.

FAQ.question: How long does it take to get the FMB Sketch?
FAQ.answer: If available digitally, it can be downloaded instantly; otherwise, it may take 1â€“2 working days depending on survey department record availability.

FAQ.question: What information does the FMB Sketch contain?
FAQ.answer: It includes boundary measurements, angles, plot layout, subdivision details, adjoining property boundaries, and survey reference markings.
